results.title: Director of Quality Assurance
results.description:
Sightline Payment is seeking an experienced Director of Quality Assurance to join our team to lead the Quality Assurance department, manage third party relationships and contractors, and build an automation test framework. This role reports to the SVP of the Project Management Office. You will establish good testing practices, be responsible for manual and automated testing and mentoring others with the QA team. Success in this role requires the spirit of collaboration, clear communication, and the ability to maintain a strategic focus amidst competing priorities. The ideal candidate will thrive in fast-paced, ambiguous start- up environments.

This role is offering a base salary in the range of $118,000-$130,000, depending on experience. The top end of the range will be reserved for those applicants with gaming and casino operations experience. There is the potential to earn up to an additional 20% annually in bonus. Our benefits start on the 1st of the month after the start date and include unlimited PTO, up to a 3% match on 401K contributions, paid parental leave, and a robust health benefits package.


Here is an idea of some of the day to day duties of the role:

  • Hires and trains QA staff.
  • Oversees the daily workflow and schedules of the department including the management of external third-party partnerships.
  • Evaluates external resources and solutions where applicable and makes appropriate recommendations to PMO leadership.
  • Investigate, recommend, implement, and manage automated testing platform and supporting tools.
  • Conducts performance evaluations that are timely and constructive.
  • Handles discipline and termination of employees in accordance with company policy.
  • Represent the QA department to senior management and champion QA best practices in accordance to the company's SDLC processes.
  • Utilize basic statistical tools (e.g., SPC, variation, stability, control) to analyze for trends or issues.
  • Prepare any required reporting documentation for the respective testing activities.
  • Ensures test cases are traceable to originating story/requirement and those tests fully test feature requirements and/or user story acceptance criteria.
  • Drive efficiencies in the QA process and mentor other QA team members in automation
  • Collaborate with lead developers, unit testing engineer, and business analysts to develop, design and execute automated test scripts and scenarios
  • Develops, implements, and manages processes to ensure that products meet required specifications for quality, function, and reliability prior to delivery.
  • Identifies and sets appropriate quality standards and parameters for products.
  • Communicates quality standards and parameters to QA team, product development team, and other appropriate staff.
  • Orchestrates product testing processes and ensures testing environments are maintained and are simulating production.
  • Identifies and analyzes issues, bugs, defects, and other problems, particularly when problems recur in multiple products; recommends and facilitates solutions to these issues.
  • Establishes and maintains cadence with development to set testing expectations.
  • Reviews client, customer, and user feedback.
  • Maintains compliance with federal, state, local, and organizational laws, regulations, guidelines, and policies.


Here is an idea of some of the experience you'll need to have to be considered for the role:

  • 5+ years managing a QA team
  • Experience working with third party service providers and contract employees
  • College Degree in Computer Science or related field
  • Gaming or payment industry experience a plus
  • 2+ years Web and Mobile application development testing experience
  • 5+ years of experience developing test automation framework using Selenium or similar tools
  • 2+ years with API testing with Postman or GET
  • Experience with Git, Azure DevOps, Jenkins, CI/CD, Java, C#, BrowserStack
  • Highly adaptable to a changing environment
  • Excellent written and verbal communication
  • Additional QA certifications
  • Azure Dev Ops and experience implementing and executing the Test Plans Module

Sightline Payments is the recognized industry leader in innovative cashless gaming solutions and has placed multiple programs supporting gaming verticals in the United States. Our Play+ solution offers players a truly cashless gaming experience with complete flexibility for how manage and spend their funds. We offer flexible integration choices to meet our client’s operating environment and preferred user experience, support communications with multiple gaming systems, and manage all aspects of our program from conception to ongoing program success. We are rapidly growing company that is positioned to meet the challenges of an evolving gaming ecosystem market.

Our environment is entrepreneurial and fast-paced. Individual and creative contributions to our company objectives are highly encouraged and recognized. There will be an abundance of opportunities to develop new skills and to benefit from interaction with a highly experienced leadership team.

results.title: UI/UX and Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer
results.description:
Be part of a disruptive MedTech technology, benefiting millions of people globally.

Ocuwell is seeking to appoint a Product Designer and Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer for 12 months with the potential to extend or become permanent. This role is open to internationals, residing outside the UK.

THE COMPANY

OCUWELL is a MedTech spin-out that provides accurate, portable, point-of-care assessment of corneal topography at <20% of the cost of existing devices, solving the problem of health inequalities in developing countries, widening access to rapid diagnostic excellence and progression monitoring elsewhere. Ocuwell's aim is to reduce the risk of blindness and visual impairment due to corneal disorders (keratoconus; dry eyes; cataract; myopia and astigmatism); revolutionise the delivery of eye care around the world and address an immediate global market of £3.2BN.

THE POSITION

To achieve its targets, the company created a handheld device that communicates with an app responsible for transferring data to a cloud platform and receiving results. This project seeks to develop a cloud platform that houses core algorithms, enables interaction between various stakeholders and returns clinical results to the end user. As part of this effort, there is a need to build a new highly secured and regulated cloud infrastructure, develop a modern frontend and optimise UI/UX.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

You will be working in an agile team of developers and will take the lead in identifying problems, suggesting solutions, monitoring development and deploying high-quality products. You will have a strong background and experience relevant to your role that satisfies these requirements. Your primary focus is the appearance and functionality of the platform, and you will produce UI/UX designs using XD or Figma, designing and implementing tests, debugging and defining corrective actions. Through collaboration with our skilled team, you will help deploy our novel, and disruptive medical device in the global market and millions of people around the world will benefit from the output of your work.

  • Creating user-centred designs by understanding business requirements, and user feedback
  • Expert skills in delivering transformative user interfaces and user experiences
  • Review requirements, specifications and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback
  • Create detailed, comprehensive and well-structured test plans and test cases
  • Design, develop and execute automation scripts using open source tools
  • Identify, record, document thoroughly and track bugs
  • Perform thorough regression testing when bugs are resolved
  • Develop and apply testing processes for new and existing products to meet client needs
  • Liaise with internal teams (e.g. developers and product managers) to identify system requirements
  • Monitor debugging process results
  • Track quality assurance metrics, like defect densities and open defect counts
  • Stay up-to-date with new testing tools and test strategies

ESSENTIAL CRITERIA

You'll have coding experience and extensive expertise in designing user interfaces and user experiences, be confident in testing a web app, finding problems and suggesting improvements, passionate about making a difference and want to be involved throughout the product lifecycle, from idea generation, design, and prototyping to execution, and shipping whilst having experience with:

  • At least 3 years of UI/UX and QA experience
  • Able to use XD or Figma in addition to relevant graphic design software packages
  • Proven work experience in software development
  • Proven work experience in software quality assurance
  • Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools and processes
  • Experience in writing clear, concise and comprehensive test plans and test cases
  • Hands-on experience with both white box and black box testing
  • Hands-on experience with automated testing tools
  • Experience working with version control systems
  • Ability to work well within a team and adapt to change
  • Experience working within an agile environment
  • A test-and-learn mindset focused on continuous improvement
  • Able to start from 1st of Feb 2023 or shortly after
  • You will have the confidence to present your ideas and communicate effectively

DESIRABLE CRITERIA

  • You will demonstrate a genuine passion for your work
  • You will contribute positively to the company's growth and culture
  • You have experience with software ISO standards in the healthcare industry
  • You have experience in performance and/or security testing

YOU'LL WORK WITH

You will join an agile team and work alongside other skilled developers, a scrum master and a product owner. The team will meet daily to discuss new approaches and challenges. You will interact with a number of other stakeholders including researchers, regulators and patients.

BENEFITS

1. Salary

We do not have a set salary for this position, as it will be dependent on the successful candidate's experience and location.

2. Option pool

An option pool refers to a block of company equity that has been reserved for you as an early employee. You can exercise your stock options which would allow you to buy a predetermined amount of company stock at a predetermined strike price. This is a win-win for employees and employers as Ocuwell grows.

3. Work-life balance

We recognise that work is only one part of your life and making time for other things is essential – whether that's for your families, friends, or yourself. Our fully remote and hybrid working policies allow the flexibility to work from the comfort of your own home as well as collaborate in our equipped office in Liverpool.

4. Inclusivity & Diversity

We approach our work fearlessly, learn quickly, improve constantly, and celebrate our wins at every turn. Everyone is welcome—as an inclusive workplace, our employees are comfortable bringing their whole authentic selves to work.

We provide equal opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, religion and belief, age, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, gender identity, genetic disposition, neurodiversity, disability, marriage and civil partnership, veteran status or any other protected characteristics.

Be you.

5. Health & Wellbeing

We are committed to supporting our people, giving you the tools to make improvements to your health and wellbeing through our ever-growing tools and programmes.

6. Flex your time

For improved work-life balance, Ocuwell offers the “Ocu Hour” which enables you to take one hour per day to do as you wish and make up the time earlier or later that day. We also offer part-time and flexible working arrangements plus the option to flex your bank holiday entitlement to suit you. If you live abroad, we respect your national and religious holidays. In addition, you enjoy 22 days of holidays.

7. Your development

We appreciate that development and training are important to you and that's why we have a supportive environment that invests in your development, whether that's chartership, training or mentoring.

Application Closing Date: All applications must be received by the 15th of January 2023

results.title: Junior QA Analyst - WTFast
results.description:
About WTFast

WTFast - the world leader in low latency internet route optimization since 2009. We were the first to truly innovate in this space, literally flipping the Internet model upside down. We have created an amazing plug and play networking solution, powered by real-time statistics and an expert system. With 6 granted patents, and more to come, we are re-inventing the Internet. We are a talented team based out of Kelowna that likes to create amazing technologies to solve latency issues for online gaming.

We are looking for a hard working individual to be an integral part of our amazing QA Team. The QA Engineer will have strong knowledge of quality assurance processes, conduct testing on software, websites, and other technical products to identify and resolve bugs, defects, and other potential issues.You must also be able to work independently, take initiative and have effective time management skills.

What We Value

Our core cultural values are manifested in our practices and processes every day. We highly value transparency and fairness in everything we do. We look for people who like to move quickly, are ambitious yet humble and have a great sense of humour. If you have a mischievous spark of fun, that’s even better.

You Are:

  • World class; you have a natural tendency to be innovative and cutting edge using creative problem solving.
  • Customer focused; listening and understanding first before acting with a strong desire to always be helpful, professional and respectful.
  • A team player; teamwork is your middle name. You want to brainstorm with the best of them and are continually looking for ways to do it better.
  • Accountable; you value accuracy and take ownership with a data driven approach.

We list our values and beliefs first because they are non-negotiable; if you're still reading then check out some of the responsibilities you will own.

This is an entry level position and a great opportunity to join WTFast. This role will focus on manual testing with some exposure to scripting and automation.

Responsibilities

  • Design and implement testing plans for existing and new products
  • Identify procedures and scenarios for the quality control of products and services
  • Process product reviews and inform the development team of defects and errors
  • Communicate quantitative and qualitative findings from test results to the development team
  • Monitor efforts to resolve product issues and track progress
  • Ensure that the final product satisfies the product requirements and meet end-user expectations
  • Be comfortable with manual testing as we work to develop automated testing.

Requirements

WHAT YOU’LL NEED

  • Strong communication and collaboration skills
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with experience in analyzing processes, initiatives and systems
  • Working Knowledge of script writing and experience with test automation
  • Experience with Jira, Linux and Postman
  • Knowledge of industry standard best practices of software testing
  • Experience in automated testing methodologies, frameworks, and tools

NICE TO HAVE

  • Bachelor’s Degree preferably in Computer Science
  • Love of video games and knowledge of the gaming industry a bonus
  • Programming experience with ZAPTEST, selenium, or cypress
  • Familiarity with working in an agile environment (using Jira to communicate / track progress)

Benefits

Our greatest asset is our people. In addition to our dedicated, innovative and collaborative atmosphere we offer eligible employees;

  • Competitive compensation
  • Extended health and dental care
  • Minimum 20 days paid time off
  • Learning and development opportunities
  • Work Remotely

results.title: QA Tester
results.description:
Hi 👋  I’m Sylvie, and I lead QA at Ashby. As our team and customer base grow, we are looking for the next QA Tester to join our team and continue building an excellent QA process together. We strive to automate most of the mundane parts of QA testing, and currently use a mix of manual and automated testing. 

 

Collaborating with the engineering team in releasing exciting new features, and investigating bugs for the customer support team are our main priorities. One of the best parts of my job is building trusting relationships with our engineers, and feeling like I have a direct impact on making our product not only usable for our customers but beloved by them!

 

You might be the perfect match for our team if:

  • You are detail-oriented and are an excellent communicator - someone who is committed to creating great collaborations with engineers and customer service

  • You are terrific at time management and taking initiative, being able to think outside of the box to find solutions

  • You can scale up your knowledge of the Ashby product systematically and document workflows for easily reproducible QA. You love to learn!

  • You are passionate about the customer experience and ensuring it’s constantly exceeding expectations.

Bonus

  • You have experience working with a complex and technical product

  • You are familiar with automation and creating automated tests

  • You can use SQL and similarly advanced methods for debugging

 

What We’re Building

At Ashby, we’re improving the productivity of working professionals (starting with talent teams) with intelligent and powerful software. We put a lot of effort into designing products that are approachable to beginners but mastered and extended by power users. In many ways, spreadsheets set the bar here.

 

We have many customers who love us, and we have great investors like YCombinator, Elad Gil, and Lachy Groom. I’ll share more once we meet.

 

Our Culture

Our team culture is motivated by Abhik and Benji’s (our co-founders) belief that a small talented team, given the right environment, can build high-quality software fast (and work regular hours!).

 

Collaboration is Natural, Communication is Deliberate

Our team consists of lifelong learners who are humble and kind (meet them here!). These attributes create an environment where collaboration happens naturally (we filter for it in interviews). We combine this with research, prototyping, and written proposals to see around corners and get feedback from the team across time zones. Focus time is sacred, and individual contributors have less than 2 hours of meetings per week (Abhik wrote about it here). 

 

Give Ownership & Autonomy

Our culture reflects the experience of having a deep understanding of the end-user and the business and ownership over the solution: individual contributors, including engineers, own projects end-to-end, from speaking with users to writing product specs to UX design. These are skills that we often don’t get to practice, and, at Ashby, we provide mentorship to grow them and help from the team where you want it. 

 

Put Effort into Diversity 

Diverse teams drive innovation and better outcomes. Having built my career as a woman in non-diverse fields, I am fully invested in making sure Ashby creates opportunities for individuals from underrepresented groups.

 

Today, 39% of Ashby identifies as women or non-binary, 10% from underrepresented ethnic groups in tech. It’s not great, and we are taking conscious steps to improve, like sourcing diverse candidates, providing generous paid family leave, and more.

 

Interview Process

At Ashby, our team and interview process want to help you show your best self. We’ll dive into past projects and get an idea of your approach to QA by having you record a QA process for part of our product. Our interview process is three rounds:

 

  • 45-minute introduction call

  • A take-home assignment where you will document a QA workflow (4 hours max)

  • A meeting with a cofounder (30 minutes)

  • A virtual on-site of 2 hours and 30 minutes (can be split across two days)

 

Your hiring manager will be your main point of contact and prep you for interviews. You can get a product demo as early as the introductory call. During the interview process, you’ll meet a co-founder plus 4 to 6 people in engineering (with 15 minutes in each interview to ask them questions). If we don’t give an offer, we’ll provide feedback!

 

Benefits

  • Competitive salary and equity.

  • 10-year exercise window for stock options. You shouldn’t feel pressure to purchase stock options if you leave Ashby —do it when you feel financially comfortable.

  • Unlimited PTO with four weeks recommended per year. Expect “Vacation?” in our one-on-one agenda until you start taking it 😅.

  • Twelve weeks of fully paid family leave in the US. We plan to expand this to employees in other countries as situations arise.

  • Generous equipment, software, and office furniture budget. Get what you need to be happy and productive!

  • $100/month education budget with more expensive items (like conferences) covered with manager approval.

  • If you’re in the US, top-notch health insurance for you and your dependents with all premiums covered by us.

 

Ashby’s success hinges on hiring great people and creating an environment where we can be happy, feel challenged, and do our best work. We’re being deliberate about building that environment from the ground up. I hope that excites you enough to apply.




Ashby provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce and welcome people from all backgrounds, experiences, perspectives, and abilities.

results.title: Senior Software Developer In Test
results.description:
About us:  
D-Wave is the leader in the development and delivery of quantum computing systems, software, and services and is the world’s first commercial supplier of quantum computers. Our mission is to unlock the power of quantum computing by delivering customer value with practical quantum applications for problems as diverse as logistics, artificial intelligence, materials sciences, drug discovery, cybersecurity, fault detection, and financial modeling.    
 
D-Wave’s systems and quantum cloud services are being used by some of the world’s most advanced organizations, including Volkswagen, DENSO, Lockheed, and Los Alamos National Laboratory. We have also appeared in Time Magazine, MIT Technology Review, Forbes, INC Magazine and Wired.     
 
As of August 8, 2022, our organization is a publicly traded quantum computing company, trading on the NYSE as ($QBTS). 
 
About the role:  
D-Wave’s Test Engineering team is seeking a Senior Software Developer in Test! In this role, you will be on a team of highly motivated software developers working with our software, applications and DevOps teams to test, automate, monitor, deploy and advance our state-of-the-art hybrid and quantum computing service.  
 
Your primary focus will be the Leap cloud platform and hybrid solver service with aspects of manual and automated test development, performance testing, test ops, and CI/CD automation. You will collaborate on the entire development process end-to-end from technical requirements review, and development, through implementation) along with enhancing our sophisticated test automation infrastructure.
 
You will have the opportunity to influence the future of our products and get exposure to a full quantum computing stack from the client side all the way through to the classical systems driving the QPU.   



What you'll do:
  • Develop comprehensive test plans and test cases 
  • Design, develop and implement automated test cases and test infrastructure for validating existing and new features 
  • Review and translate customer/business/product requirements and product goals into appropriate end-to-end and functional tests 
  • Maintain acceptable code coverage through automated regression tests 
  • Report, monitor and track the resolution of defects 
  • Design, implement, and operate our deployment pipelines for cloud systems  
  • Use your experience and expertise to provide architectural and design guidance to our development teams for our cloud services  
  • Work with the software development and DevOps teams to streamline our build processes and release management via continuous integration and deployment pipelines  
  • Take ownership and participate in root-cause analysis of production incidents 
  • Continuously monitor and improve the performance and reliability of regression test suites 



What you'll bring:
  • A degree in Computing Science, Engineering or equivalent education and experience 
  • 3+ years of professional experience in UI test automation/quality assurance or software development role 
  • 3+ years of professional experience developing automated test cases  
  • 2+ years of related programming experience in Python, Ruby, Groovy, Go, or a comparable language including specifically working with 3rd party REST APIs  
  • A methodical approach and a good eye for detail 
  • Ability to succeed in a fast-paced, collaborative team 
  • Knowledge of modern software testing methodologies, OOP, tools and processes 
  • Aptitude towards designing and architecting high-quality, reliable software test assets including test design, approach, scripts and bugs 
  • Experience in an Agile Environment 
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills - you like to document your work! 



Bonus points for:
  • Experience in architecting, configuring, deploying, operating, and troubleshooting modern SaaS/PaaS web applications and environments on a major cloud platform  
  • Experience with monitoring systems such as Kibana, Grafana 
  • Expert in source code control, managing artifacts, configuration management / configuration as code, CI/CD pipelines, etc. e.g. Git, Terraform, Docker, Jenkins, Spinnaker, or their equivalents  
Additional information:  
We celebrate diverse perspectives to drive innovation in our pursuit. Our employees range from distinguished domain experts with decades of experience in their respective fields, to bright and motivated graduates eager to make their mark.  
 
Our diverse and innovative team will make you feel appreciated, supported and empower your career growth at D-Wave.    
 
No 3rd party candidates will be accepted.
 
It is D-Wave Systems Inc. policy to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state/provincial, local law.

results.title: QA engineer (Python)
results.description:

EXANTE is a wealthtech company that provides centralised trading solutions and B2B financial infrastructure that helps create value through technology.

Our proprietary trading platform enables direct market access to a wide range of financial instruments including stocks, ETFs, bonds, futures, options and more from a single multi-currency account.

With over 600 employees and a decade in the market, EXANTE’s presence extends across over 10 locations, including but not limited to the UK, Cyprus, Malta and Hong Kong.

We're growing 70% year-on-year and hiring globally day-by-day. Learn more about the EXANTE corporate culture and company benefits: https://careers.exante.eu/about/

QA engineer with experience in both manual and automated backend testing

Python + pytest

Ability to work in bash and with SQL also

Experience with JSON, XML

 

Key resposibilities:

- formalization of the test base in TMS (Qase);

The advantage will be:

Benefits

  • A working laptop;

  • Minimum bureaucracy and the ability to move to other teams.

results.title: QA Engineer Senior (Java / Python/SIP)
results.description:

results.title: Senior Quality and Release Manager
results.description:
Echo360 seeks an experienced Senior Quality and Release Manager - And? to join our team on our journey to help instructors, teachers, and trainers improve learning outcomes by driving deeper engagement with content. As an ideal candidate, you are familiar with software quality assurance best practices, methodologies, technologies, and architectures. You are detail oriented and have experience managing teams and projects.


Objectives of this Role

  • Oversee the creation and execution of both automated and manual regression test cases in a fast-paced SaaS based software environment.
  • Manage a growing team of dedicated software quality assurance engineers as they learn new solutions, create, and execute thorough test cases and workflows.
  • Enable the quality assurance team to successfully engage with other departments within the Echo360 organization, including software development teams, product management, technical writers, and support.
  • Ensure pre-deployment regression testing and post-deployment tests are executed correctly and efficiently.
  • Collaborate directly with the Echo360 leadership team to identify, evaluate, and prioritize any software issues discovered during testing.
  • Help maintain testing technologies, architectures, and product environments necessary to test both native product functionality and system integrations.
  • Be the gatekeeper coordinating tickets from support to various Engineering departments.

Requirements

  • Review, and provide feedback on new test cases, bugs, questions, and other escalations raised by the quality assurance team.
  • Define, generate, and refine quality related metrics.
  • Coordinate change management requests on shared development and test resources.
  • Supervise daily activities of employees and contractors, providing technical leadership and process guidance.
  • Schedule and oversee bi-weekly full software regression tests prior to product releases, post release testing, and any other ad hoc testing as requested by our engineering and product team leaders.
  • Oversee daily stand-up meetings with the quality assurance team to ensure consistent project momentum.
  • Regularly review software quality and team performance metrics to identify and address areas of focus.
  • Collaborate with and provide periodic progress reports to the product and engineering leadership teams to ensure new feature releases are fully tested and on schedule.
  • Own the overall quality of the releases including internal approvals and customer satisfaction. Coordinate timely fixes of any customer reported issues.

Skills and Qualifications

  • Minimum of four (4) years combined experience in leading and/or executing software quality assurance
  • Firm understanding of the software development life cycle (SDLC)
  • Experience testing client-server-oriented applications.
  • Strong problem-solving skills
  • Ability to effectively collaborate with multiple teams in a high-paced software development environment
  • Experience guiding migration of manual test environments an automated environment

Preferred Qualifications

  • Strong team and project management experience
  • Proven ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously, with an eye for prioritization
  • Advanced development and testing architecture skills, knowledge of testing technologies, Windows/Macintosh development environments
  • Bachelor’s degree in relevant technical field
  • Previous software development experience

Benefits

Echo360 offers competitive benefits including medical, dental, vision, life & disability insurance, 401(k) plan with employer match and an unlimited pto plan.
